page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: Until recently,there were many more rented Council houses than privately owned properties.More people are now wishing to purchase their own home. Along the banks of the Tweed 20 years ago about 25% was built-up area. The figure now is about 42%.The farming land has not changed much except where it has been taken for building sites. The styles of private and Council housing are broadly similar.Most are semi-detached with a kitchen, bathroom with toilet, three bedrooms and either separate sitting and dining rooms or, more recently, a combined sitting and dining area.The gardens are generally small.Over half of the houses have a garage.Many of the recently-built Council houses have adjacent garage space.The estates are served by regular bus routes;the railway station is often beyond walking distance.
